description.1: Any expression of intention to harm, punish, inflict pain, injury, or damage. It also includes intimidation to commit violence or killing. This can be perpetrated against beneficiaries by armed groups, non-beneficiaries, CP staff, community leaders etc.
description.2: Beneficiaries being arrested or taken away by force without a justified reason
description.4: Presence of group/s in the FDP that prevent the regular development of the distribution activities
description.5: Presence of group/s in the FDP that prevent or difficult the access of beneficiaries to the FDP
description.6: Harrasment or physical, psychological, verbal or socio-economic violence to a beneficiary at distribution site based on their gender
description.7: Physical, sexual, and/or psychological maltreatment or neglect of a child
description.8: Episodes of sexual Harassment, sexual assault by force or coercion, unwanted touching or kissing, threats of physical aggression; psychological blackmailing, having sex as a condition for assistance, name-calling, insisting on anything sexual, including jokes that may be uncomfortable, frightening or hurtful
description.9: Use of children for hard manual work by vendors, retailors and/or financial service providers
description.10: A breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, personal data
description.11: Cases where a Retailer is allegedly involved in fraud. Fraud is any act or omission, including any misrepresentation, that knowingly misleads, or attempts to mislead, a party to obtain any financial or other advantage, or to avoid any obligation whether for oneself or for others. Without limiting the foregoing, fraud could involve, among other things, misappropriation of cash (for example through fraudulent claims or disbursements) or other assets (for example through fraudulent shipments or falsifying inventory records) or fraudulent statements (for example through purposefully misreporting or omitting information)
description.12: Cases where a Cooperating Partner is allegedly involved in fraud. Fraud is any act or omission, including any misrepresentation, that knowingly misleads, or attempts to mislead, a party to obtain any financial or other advantage, or to avoid any obligation whether for oneself or for others. Without limiting the foregoing, fraud could involve, among other things, misappropriation of cash (for example through fraudulent claims or disbursements) or other assets (for example through fraudulent shipments or falsifying inventory records) or fraudulent statements (for example through purposefully misreporting or omitting information)
description.13: Cases where a Transporter is allegedly involved in fraud. Fraud is any act or omission, including any misrepresentation, that knowingly misleads, or attempts to mislead, a party to obtain any financial or other advantage, or to avoid any obligation whether for oneself or for others. Without limiting the foregoing, fraud could involve, among other things, misappropriation of cash (for example through fraudulent claims or disbursements) or other assets (for example through fraudulent shipments or falsifying inventory records) or fraudulent statements (for example through purposefully misreporting or omitting information)
description.14: Cases where WFP staff is allegedly involved in fraud. Fraud is any act or omission, including any misrepresentation, that knowingly misleads, or attempts to mislead, a party to obtain any financial or other advantage, or to avoid any obligation whether for oneself or for others. Without limiting the foregoing, fraud could involve, among other things, misappropriation of cash (for example through fraudulent claims or disbursements) or other assets (for example through fraudulent shipments or falsifying inventory records) or fraudulent statements (for example through purposefully misreporting or omitting information)
description.15: Cases where a Retailer is allegedly involved in corruption and/or extortion. Corruption is the offering, giving, receiving or soliciting, directly or indirectly, or attempt to do so, of anything of value to improperly influence the actions of another party. Corruption could involve, among other things, an abuse of a conflict of interest, improper gratuities (including unauthorized acceptance of honours, gifts or remuneration) or bribery (including kickbacks). Extortion involves requesting money or favours in exchange for receiving their entitlement
description.16: Cases where a Cooperating Partner is allegedly involved in corruption and/or extortion. Corruption is the offering, giving, receiving or soliciting, directly or indirectly, or attempt to do so, of anything of value to improperly influence the actions of another party. Corruption could involve, among other things, an abuse of a conflict of interest, improper gratuities (including unauthorized acceptance of honours, gifts or remuneration) or bribery (including kickbacks). Extortion involves requesting money or favours in exchange for receiving their entitlement
description.17: Cases where WFP staff is allegedly involved in corruption and/or extortion. Corruption is the offering, giving, receiving or soliciting, directly or indirectly, or attempt to do so, of anything of value to improperly influence the actions of another party. Corruption could involve, among other things, an abuse of a conflict of interest, improper gratuities (including unauthorized acceptance of honours, gifts or remuneration) or bribery (including kickbacks). Extortion involves requesting money or favours in exchange for receiving their entitlement
description.18: The Cooperating Partner reports being requested to pay additional costs by the transporter e.g. labour/offloading or other costs
description.19: CP is collaborating with military, religious or political parties, compromising the humanitarian principles of neutrality, impartiality, independence and humanity
description.20: A situation in which a person is in a position to derive personal benefit from actions or decisions made in their official capacity. For example if a family relative of WFP/CP staff member is hired to work at the food distribution site
description.21: Collusive practice is an arrangement among two or more parties designed to achieve an improper purpose. This can include collusion between CP staff/military/retailers/community members to mismanage WFP food
description.22: Any party involved (including but not limited to WFP staff, CP, Retailer, Transporter, PMC, local authorities, military, or traditional leaders) in the practice of persuading someone to do something by using force or threats
description.23: Theft of assistance (food commodities, cash, vouchers) from a place/project site (not from a person), typically in a disorderly manner as a result of an attack or unrest
description.24: The act of taking another person's belongings at the FDP/project site by anyone (including a persone's personal documentation)
description.25: Warehouse theft/robery can be from external sources (such as burglars) but also from internal sources (WFP staff, Retailer, CP, Transporter)
description.26: Sale of WFP food at a commercial level by CP/community authorities. This can also include WFP livelihood materials, seedlings, livestock stolen or diverted by beneficiary/CP
description.27: Cooperating partner staff or management committee or retailer serving a particular person or group before others based on the groups, classes, or other categories to which they belong or are perceived to belong
description.28: Treatment of one individual or group of individuals in a manner that is likely to lead to greater benefits, access, rights, opportunities or status than those of another individual or group of individuals based on personal acquaintance
description.29: Beneficiaries treated disrespectfully by CP/WFP/Community workers/retailers at distribution site
description.30: Activity running behind schedule due to the delay of any of its tasks
description.31: Distribution does not occur as per schedule. Reason for delay could have been avoided, it has not been communicated and/or leads to beneficiaries traveling after daylight hours
description.32: The food/cash distribution/payments are suspended for known or unknown reasons by CP/FSP
description.33: Beneficiaries have to travel more than once to the distribution site to get their assistance when it was planned only one travel
description.34: Cash disbursement issues such as payment delayed even if Financial service provider has received WFP communication to start distribution
description.35: Shortfalls in commodity or absence of a commodity are sometimes encountered due to pipeline break, this leads to incomplete basket,  e.g. no salt, insufficient groundnut oil etc. This should be communicated ahead of distribution to avoid issues during distribution
description.36: Beneficiary / beneficiaries reporting high distances to and from the distribution site, long commuting times to and from the distribution site and/or high costs to reach the distribution site
description.37: Commodities being distributed in locations that have not being officially approved
description.38: Refusal to have the beneficiaries registered (especially from minority groups) or unintended exclusion of beneficiaries from the list
description.39: Ineligible or non-registered persons participating in livelihood activities since have been included in the distribution site list (e.g. military, community leaders, persons with means etc.)
description.40: Targeting criteria intentionally or unintentionally being wrongly applied
description.41: Beneficiary / beneficiaries reporting high distances to and from the distribution site, long commuting times to and from the distribution site and/or high costs to reach the distribution site
description.42: Beneficiary / Beneficiaries experiencing issues during the registration process
description.43: Targeting selection process has not been thoroughtly done, resulting in persons with means or not the most vulnerable ones being selected for programme participation
description.44: Beneficiary database poorly manages, resulting in incomplete information and wrong information among others
description.45: Beneficiary / Beneficiaries not receiving (intentionally or unintentionally) their full entitlement
description.46: Beneficiary / Beneficiaries not receiving entitlemes with the expecte quality (poor condition, rotten...)
description.47: Beneficiary selling assistance to ohter beneficiaries or to the market
description.48: Beneficiary sharing assistance (on its decisions or being forced) with other people
description.49: Beneficiary exchangin assistance with other commodities
description.50: Food is not well packed, compromising its human consumption due to potential external contamination
description.51: Food has been cross contaminated due to the interaction of other undesired food
description.52: Food cold chain has been compromised, potentially compromising its human consumption
description.53: Food safety compromised due to a power shortage
description.54: Food labelling missing or food wrongly labelled
description.55: Foods that deteriorate and develop unpleasant odors, tastes and/or textures
description.56: Food expiration day is between 30 to 60 days from the distribution date
description.57: Food is already expired or is going to expire less than 30 days from the distribution date
description.58: Food expiry dates not clearly shown or not present
description.59: WFP commodities wrongly handled, including but not limited to: Transporter/Retailer/CP/WFP staff not treating the commodities with the adequate safety measures, potentially harming them
description.60:
WFP commodities improperly stored, including but not limited to: Improper ventilation, Leakage in roofing, No pallets or inadequate pallets or tarps, Unkept environment/shelves/cupboards
Inadequate storage space, Hazardous NFI found in warehouse, No fire extinguisher at warehouse
description.61: Commodity items too heavy or hard to carry by beneficiaries
description.62: Food losses due to 1) transporter being compromised, attacked by persons, had an accident or a vehicle breakdown or 2) during storage at warehouse (i.e. dampness, infestation or other poor storage conditions)
description.63: CBT card / voucher lost by beneficiary
description.64: Beneficiary / Beneficiaries didn't receive a new card / voucher
description.66: Shortfalls or absence of funds to cover the distribution plan
description.67: Prices are set higher than market ones
description.68: Food is paid higher than the displayed prices
description.69: Beneficiaries lacking receipts of their bought items
description.70: Beneficiaries not able to see  the food prices before buying
description.71: Beneficiares not able to choose among different foods as per contract. Retailer is imposing certain  foods to be bought
description.72: Retailer stocking only they preferred items and not all the items agreed with WFP
description.73: Other challenges faced with the retailer
description.74: Management committee not performing as expected and/or performing in a wrong way
description.75: Distribution volunteers not active, resulting in distribution inefficiencies and/or delays
description.76: Any type of imposed exclusion, restriction or preference based on race, color, disability, descent, national or ethnic origin that impairs or denies the access to management committees
description.77: Crowd control measures are not (adequately) in place. For example distributions are not done in orderly manner and disorder erupts or can erupt as a direct result. Please attach evidence (photos or videos) if available
description.78: Distribution records are not correctly managed. For example: not all HH members of a targeted HH are included in the records or distribution list/register/record includes fake names or double counting
description.79: The IDs of beneficiaries are not being thoroughly checked
description.80: Nutrition measures (i.e. MUAC) are not considered/recorderd as per guidelines
description.81: WFP signboard/banners/materials not adequatly visible in the site (not CFM or other specific sensitization posters)
description.82: Observed evidence of negative impact of the understaffing on the implementation. For example instances in which CP technical staff is not available at a FFA project site. Please attach evidence (photos or videos) if available
description.83: CP staff is not deliivering the adequate key messages regarding the programme to the beneficiaries. It includes, for example, messages regarding who is entitled to receive assistance or how to request it
description.84: WFP logo/name is being misued in the site
description.85: There are no scales available or they are not calibrated correctly (to be tested thoroughtly)
description.86: There is not enough equipment (or not in the correct condition) to ensure the necessary measurements
description.87: Distribution site is not adequate in terms of size, safety, cleanliness, shaded areas, accomodating special needs, toilets, sitting arrangements etc.
description.88: People with disabilities do not have special arrangements in the distribution site, resulting in inconveniences and/or incidents
description.89: There is no gender diversity among the staff in the distribution site
description.90: There are no toilets available for beneficiaries in the distribution facility
description.91: There are no gender separated waiting lines, resulting in actual or potential security issues
description.92: There are not (or of insufficient quality) pallets, fire extinguishers and/or rodents control
description.93: Storage conditions are not adequate for human consumption food (i.e., dampness, infestation, no ventilation...)
description.94: Food items next to non food items which can result in potential food contamination
description.95: Distribution site not following WFP guidelines (i.e., in terms of spacing, ventilation...)
description.96: Distribution site construction was significantly different from the approved plan
description.97: Distribution site infrastructure is of poor quality (i.e., worn out, damaged...)
description.98: Distribution site building activities have suffered a major delay impacting on the safety and efficiency of the programme
description.99: When beneficiaries are not aware of their enetilements/CFM etc. They should have been informed by CP/info materials
description.100: Lack of visibility at project site in terms if entitlements
description.101: Including instances where a wrong WFP hotline number is recorded
description.102: Beneficiary / beneficiaries refuses to receive particular food at the distribution site
description.103: Quantity of assistance does not match beneficiary expectation and complains at the distribution site
description.104: Modality does not match beneficiary preference and complains at the distribution site
description.105: Beneficiary expressing their preference on quality of food rather than quantity (the beneficiary didn't use or didn't like some of the food received)
description.106: Training dissemination does not reach WFP standards (not enough training provided)
description.107: Training dissemination is not done in an effective way, avoiding recipients to develop knowledge and skills
description.108: Trainees not able to put in practive their knowledge and skills. Please specify the reason preventing them
description.109: Beneficiaries are not aware of important project details (why it has been launched, why the given transfer modalitie and quantity have been decided...)
description.110: There has not been a gender analysis preceding the programme intervention, resulting in clear gender imbalances
description.111: The decision-making regarding the use of WFP assistance has been done through a top-down approach, not sufficiently involving the beneficiaries
description.112: Due to a lack of previous consultation with the beneficiary representatives, a beneficiary had to postpone or cancel other tasks to participate in the distribution
description.113: CP staff is not cooperative with field monitors, difficulting their job
description.114: CP reports do not meet WFP standards. For example there is missing or incomplete information, entire sections are missing, reports are sent with significant delays
description.115: Distribution being done by middle-men not authorised by WFP
description.116: Other challenges encountered within the CP relationship
